title: [DOC] Add more canonical examples to the "Developing Documentation" page
body:
#### Describe the issue linked to the documentation
Raising this from this [discussion](https://github.com/sktime/sktime/pull/4015#issuecomment-1367523875).

I found that in the docs of the [`TimeSince`](https://www.sktime.org/en/latest/api_reference/auto_generated/sktime.transformations.series.time_since.TimeSince.html?highlight=TimeSince) transformer that the parameters were not being correctly rendered. I looked [here](https://www.sktime.org/en/stable/developer_guide/documentation.html) to find out how I could remedy this. I found it difficult to understand where indents, spaces, and newlines were required. I initially looked at examples in the link to [NumPy docstring format](https://numpydoc.readthedocs.io/en/latest/format.html).  However, I was looking for an example where there is a list in the parameters section and could not find this. @aiwalter kindly re-directed me to the [`Imputer`](https://www.sktime.org/en/v0.15.0/api_reference/auto_generated/sktime.transformations.series.impute.Imputer.html) documentation. 

#### Suggest a potential alternative/fix

Add more canonical examples which cover a wider range of scenarios (e.g., a list of types in the parameters section).
